info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 6:01AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG ACROSS PARTS OF THE Charlotte metro area and northern UPSTATE... Clear sky, light wind, and lingering moisture near the surface has allowed for fog to develop across the southern Piedmont of North Carolina and the northern Upstate of South Carolina, including parts of metro Charlotte, early this morning. The fog was locally dense from Shelby and Gastonia down to Rock Hill, Chester, and over to Monroe. The fog may continue to expand a bit more through sunrise, until a cold front pushes south across the area after daybreak. Until that happens, be on the lookout for sharply reduced visibility to one half mile or less if you have to drive through sunrise.
